- What do the Scots normally call New Year's Eve?

1564.00.text: Which ferry port lies on Holy Island on the north-west tip of Wales?

1570.76.text: What word for an apartment occupying two or more floors

1573.96.text: and often having its own entrance from outside

1576.68.text: is a diminutive of the French for house?

1580.44.text: In which city was the green cloth

1582.32.text: traditionally worn by Robin Hood manufactured?

1586.24.text: Which Soviet leader died in 1953 and had a name meaning man of steel?

1591.20.text: In what event did Greg Rutherford become the fifth Briton

1594.24.text: to hold the grand slam of four titles when he won the gold medal

1597.36.text: in the World Athletics Championships in Beijing in August 2015?

1602.04.text: In which novel by Richard Adams

1603.80.text: do Hazel and Fiver lead a band of rabbits in search of a safer home,

1606.88.text: it was later made into an animated film?

1609.92.text: Who made up the pop duo Wham! with George Michael?

1614.44.text: Which London Theatre, just south of Waterloo Bridge,

1617.52.text: was known as the Royal Coburg when it opened in 1818?

1621.72.text: Er, just south of Waterloo Bridge.

1626.64.text: No, it was the Old Vic.

1629.48.text: And you had one pass. The Scots call New Year's Eve Hogmanay.

1646.00.text: Well, he held on to that lead. Let's have a look at all the scores.

1651.72.text: Joint second place, 21 points apiece, Alistair and Ben.

1675.08.text: Well done. There's the...there's the plotline for your next sitcom.

1679.92.text:
- A quiz show. 
- Thank you, Mr Humphrys. A starring role? Are you busy?

1684.28.text:
- We'll get you in. 
- You're on. 
- No problem.

1687.56.text: You don't have to be a celebrity

1689.32.text: to take part in the regular Mastermind programme.

1692.20.text: If you'd like to appear in the next series of Mastermind on BBC2,

1699.76.text: You can follow us on Twitter at ...

1702.32.text: Either way, join us again next time for more Mastermind.
